intro: Kyllinga longiculmis, commonly known as the long-stemmed spikerush, is a herbaceous plant belonging to the Cyperaceae family. It is characterized by its slender, grass-like stems and compact, spike-like inflorescences. The plant typically grows in wet or marshy environments, thriving in shallow water or moist soil. Its leaves are usually narrow and slightly pointed, while its flowers are small and clustered. Kyllinga longiculmis is often found in tropical and subtropical regions, contributing to the ecological diversity of wetland habitats.
